TopicTitle: [1.1.2] Grappling unit will not free pivot

Articles.Content:
Hi

Ok, so I can't free pivot my grappling units on any of my rovers on the mun from a previous save.
However, if I build a new craft at the Space Center it works perfectly.

Stuff I have tried:

* copy-pasted all outdated mods + saves without changing anything in to 1.1.2 without any change regarding the free pivot issue.

* Updated all mods with newer version available with no change.

* Removed all mods - free pivot on the mun works.
  I then start adding mods until it stopped working.
  When I added the 'community resource pack' it stopped working, so I removed it, but after a while it stopped working anyways...

 

The point of my mun base is that everything is built with the extraplanetary launchpads-mod, including rovers. (if it could have any relevance)

 

Mods:

KSP: 1.1.2 (Win64) - Unity: 5.2.4f1 - OS: Windows 7  (6.1.7600) 64bit (32bit has the same issue)
Community Resource Pack - 0.5.2
Contract Configurator - 1.11.5
Contract Pack: Bases and Stations - 3.2.1.2
Contract Pack: RemoteTech - 2.0.2
Contract Pack: Tourism Plus - 1.4.2
Contracts Window Plus - 1.0.5.4
Contract Parser - 1.0.3
Contracts Window Plus - 1.0.6.3
Docking Port Alignment Indicator - 6.4
Extraplanetary Launchpads - 5.3.2
MechJeb 2 - 2.5.7
Module Manager - 2.6.24
Progress Parser - 1.0.4
RasterPropMonitor - 0.26
KSP-AVC Plugin - 1.1.6.1
Docking Port Alignment Indicator - 6.4
RasterPropMonitorCore - 1:v0.26.0
RemoteTech - 1.7
SCANsat - 1.1.6
SETI-Contracts - 0.9.6
SETI-Greenhouse - 0.9.5
StageRecovery - 1.6.4
TAC Fuel Balancer - 2.6
TAC Life Support - 0.12.1
Trajectories - 1.6.1
Toolbar - 1.7.12
Waypoint Manager - 2.5.1

 

Logs:

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/104066443/ksp/32/output_log.txt
(32-bit)

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/104066443/ksp/64/output_log.txt
(64-bit)

 

 

*EDIT* 2016-05-17

Made a new rover with the EL-mod and I can now free pivot its claw. I tried this before and haven't changed anything of the above.

(however the animation for it doesn't work)

This is really annoying.

Edited May 17, 2016 by Stupid_Potato
New input
